subject: Re: A couple of questions from a newbie
msgSnippet: Thanks very much Jean-Fran�ois.  Now to practice to get my speed up in both writing and reading! Best regards, John
messageBody:
Thanks very much Jean-François. Now to practice to get my speed up in both writing and reading!

Best regards,
John

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Jean-FranÃ§ois Colson <jf@...> wrote:
>
> Le 03/04/13 17:54, stratocat6969 a Ã©crit :
> > 2) What is the use of the Alt 0230 and 0231 symbols on Mr. Burke's layout map?
> Theyâre Welsh/Irish/Scottish letters.
>
> The letter which looks like a Latin ch is found in many place names e.g.
> the famous Loch Ness.
>
> The reversed l is another consonnant often spelt ll as in Lloyd or Llan.
>
> > 3) What is the use of the upper case W on Mr. Burke's layout map?
>
> Thatâs simply the Ian ligature also found in Shavian: ð`¾
> It is a combination of #26 and #36.
> You may use the separate letters if you prefer. IMHO the ligature is
> there mainly because it exists in Shavian where it is compulsory.
>
> >
> > Thank you very much,
> Youâre welcome.
>
> Jean-FranÃ§ois Colson
>
